conclusion: To determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop, we need to analyze the path of the toy car (A) and the arrangement of the blocks on the green surface.
The toy car (A) is positioned on the right side of the image and is moving towards the center of the green surface.
There are multiple blocks of different colors (red, blue, green, orange, yellow, and purple) scattered on the green surface.
The path of the toy car (A) will intersect with the blocks as it moves from the right side towards the center.
The red block and the blue block are positioned directly in the path of the toy car (A).
The toy car (A) will collide with the red block and the blue block as it moves along its path.
After colliding with the red and blue blocks, the toy car (A) will stop between them due to deflection and loss of momentum.
Based on the analysis, the blocks that A will collide with are the red block and the blue block, and the final position of the toy car will be between these two blocks.
